results.title: Sea animals
results.creator_credit: Tom Gordon, Dorling Kindersley Vision and Video School
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “See how they grow”.
Another interesting episode in this instructional series on animals designed for young children. This program focuses on four sea creatures from infancy to adulthood. The animals featured are the Ray, a cousin of the shark; the Pipe-Fish, a fascinating eel-like fish; the Cuttlefish whose skeleton is a familiar sight on the beach and the Hermit Crab which hides in a shell to preserve its privacy.

results.title: The Animals of Farthing Wood
results.creator_credit: Elphin Lloyd-Jones, Philippe LeClerc, John Mills, BBC and EBU
results.brief_description: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

constellations_other.name: Make it cute, make them think
constellations_other.description: Cartoons and anime are known for their dynamic and vibrant visuals, but beneath the cuteness they can also deliver powerful environmental messages and address the climate crisis.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Elphin Lloyd-Jones, Philippe LeClerc, John Mills, BBC and EBU
results.description: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. Kestrel brings news that the humans are filling in the pond, and with no source of water, they would surely die. Toad advises that they should head for the nature reserve at White Deer Park. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

results.title: From copse to quarry
results.creator_credit: Elphin Lloyd-Jones, Philippe LeClerc, John Mills, BBC and EBU
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Animals of Farthing Wood”.
Another dazzling animated adventure for the animals of Farthing Wood. “Are you telling me that you don’t want to go on to White Deer Park?” asks Badger of the tiny fieldmice who have decided not to continue on the journey to the nature reserve. The animals are less than half way through their journey but already their fearless leader, Fox is missing, presumed drowned. It’s no surprise that morale among the animals is at an all-time low. So much as everyone loves and trusts Badger, it will need all of his strength and authority to keep the animals together, when even he must secretly doubt whether they will ever reach their destination safely… and if they do make it, will the cost have been too high?

results.title: The Infinite voyage
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences and WQED
results.brief_description: Focusing on current and compelling scientific topics, this series is a unique visual presentation that inspires students to see their world in new ways and discover how modern technologies contribute to scientific discovery. These programs go beyond the latest technology reports in newspapers, magazines, and television to the personal stories of people at the boundaries of scientific research. A journey to the very brink of scientific exploration where individuals and technology meet the unknown.

results.title: Fires of the mind: workings of the human brain
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Outlines findings of current research into the workings of the human brain - its anatomy and physiology, discoveries concerning its evolution and research into such areas as memory, the sense of self, and the human mind’s ability to reflect upon itself.

results.title: Unseen worlds: imaging from atoms to outer space
results.creator_credit: Steve Eder, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Examines a wide range of imaging techniques and their many and varied applications, such as anthropologists using computer technology to probe the remains of Egyptian mummies to discover previously unknown facts about the health and life-style of these people, or doctors using magnetic imaging to view the brain and other organs to provide treatment without resorting to invasive techniques like exploratory surgery.

results.title: Classic tales; English Gentlemen
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Best of British”.
The ultimate collection of scenes from feature films inspired by the literary giants Shakespeare, Shaw, Dickens, Wilde and Wells. Some of the great classic films based on literature are featured including “Oliver Twist”, “Caesar and Cleopatra” and ‘The Importance of being Earnest’. In the episode entitled the “English gentlemen”, the image of this stereotype as portrayed in film is discussed. It is a reflection on the urbane and sometimes eccentric characters portrayed by such stars as Rex Harrison, Michael Wilding and Stanley Holloway. Narrated by Sir John Mills.

results.title: Heaven and earth; Love story
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Best of British”.
Heaven and Earth looks at how religion has provided British films with stories that have been dramatic, controversial and inspirational including classics like “Black narcissus” and “Conspiracy of hearts.” “Love story” looks at why there will always be an audience for great film love stories such as “Romeo and Juliet”, “Brief encounter”, and “Seventh veil.” Narrated by by Sir John Mills.
